pr_title: Fix for WFLY-13967, Provide an simple overview of what a layer is at the start of the layers table

timeline.bodyText:
s/JBoss modules/JBoss Modules modules/g
or just "modules".
More words, but perhaps

A set of modules and other filesystem content that implements the capability.

Maybe that's too much information. Layers bring things other than modules is the point; e.g. core-tools, vault-tools etc.
timeline.author: bstansberry
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1,6 +1,15 @@
 [[wildfly_layers]]
 === WildFly Layers
 
+A Galleon layer is a name that identifies a server capability (e.g.: jaxrs, 
+ejb, microprofile-config, jpa) or an aggregation of such capabilities. A layer captures a server capability in the form of:
+
+* A piece of server XML configuration (e.g.: extension, configured subsystem, interfaces) that describes the capability.
+* A set of JBoss modules that implements the capability.

replies.bodyText: @bstansberry , I focused on the modules/configs. I added what you suggested. I think it is vague enough to cover the "other files".
replies.author: jfdenise
